page.title: 19Profile of Streat Hamlet
page.content: The hamlet of Streat lies mainly around the parish church with other dwellings scattered along a narrow country lane to the north and south. There are no shops, but there is a telephone kiosk and a post box outside the church. The Priest_in_Charge (of Streat and Westmeston churches) is a retired clergyman who uses his pension to supplement his salary. There are l67 on the electoral roll. There are no organisations connected with the church; there used to be a Youth Club but there are few young people now. Most of the residents are retired; a few commute to London or elsewhere and there are very few of the farming community left. There is a Women's Institute in the village and a Parish Meeting looks after village affairs.
